content.detailedDescription: My mother. son and i just witnessed the strangest sight in the sky off of our balcony. i was to late grabbing a recording device to catch it close up. i can tell you one thing. it looked like a big bright red glowing torch gliding through the sky. it had a very distinguishable red glow all around the top. kind of like a torch. i'm so pissed off that i didn't have my good video camera close by ! this was taken in the northwest skies over albuquerque's ne heights with my iphone 4s. i think we just witnessed something special.
content.summary: Very bright red glowing torch like disc shaped object crossing the horizon

content.detailedDescription: Came into the front to let dog out. noticed 4 lights in the western sky. thought they were group of planes or flares with all the fourth of july fireworks going off. but they actually became smaller as they ascended. then when they were all finally, out of sight a fifth one moved in. and ascended in the same area, of the sky, that i witnessed the initial four and disappeared from sight.
content.summary: Came into the front to let dog out. noticed 4 lights in the western sky. thought they were flares with all the fourth of july fireworks going off.
2 fireballs seperated by 10 min headed in same direction 2 one dissapered when i turned lazer on near it

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i went outside approximately between 9:15 and 9:20 to set off a few fireworks and watch neighborhood fireworks.  at approximately 9:30 we noticed and object traveling from the east to the west then southwest.  the object appeared to have 3 reddish/reddish orange lights in a triangular pattern.  it made no sound.  we observed it for approximately 5 minutes. it seemed to be really high but really big and followed a straight line and did not waiver.  my husband estimated that when it suddenly disappeared it must have been over illinois or maybe even missouri.  the object did not disappear behind trees, it disappeared from the sky like turning out a light.  several planes flew over in the next 15-20 minutes going different directions and altitudes.  all observed to have blinking lights and you could hear the engine on these planes.  i tried to take a video of the object with my phone but it was traveling the direction of the moon and it did not show up on the screen.
content.summary: While setting off fireworks, my husband and i observed object moving from east to west/southwest.  no sound heard from object.

content.detailedDescription:
My mother, son and i just witnessed the strangest sight in the sky off of our balcony. i was to late grabbing a recording device to catch it close up. i can tell you one thing. it looked like a big bright red glowing torch gliding through the sky. it had a very distinguishable red glow all around the top. kind of like a torch. i'm so pissed off that i didn't have my good video camera close by ! this was taken in the northwest skies over albuquerque's ne heights with my iphone 4s. i think we just witnessed something special.

1- we were sitting on balcony looking for fireworks in the sky

2- it was an object with an intense red glow around the top like a torch. it illuminated the sky around it.

3- it was unmistakably an unknown in the sky. i have never seen anything like this one. i have however seen many things in the sky

4- bright disc shaped object with an intense red glowing that illuminated the sky around it. looked a lot like a flying torch. slow steady movement in the direction i stated in this report.

5- our feelings were amazement and for us an overwhelming sense of knowing that this was real

8- we lost sight as it's path of movement took it away from us.

note : this was not any kind of fireworks !!
content.summary: Slow moving object from the east to northwest skies above albuquerque nm

content.detailedDescription:
First noticed this object about a month ago and reported it.  my wife and i both witnessed the object as it flew overhead.  we are in rendon texas and my first assessment was that it was a re-entry vehicle of some type due to the fact that it was glowing bright orange to the point that there was an aura around it.  no way to judge altitude but it appeared to be high.  this second sighting appeared to be lower but could not judge altitude.  traveling same direction approx 25 degrees west of north but this sighting was offset to the west by approx 2 degrees.  i have been watching satellites and the iss for years and as well as comets and meteor showers and have seen satellites re-enter the atmosphere.  this object was moving faster than an airplane but definitely not as fast as a meteor or a satellite.  total observation time the first experience was approx 45 seconds and tonight was approx 20 seconds because it was past overhead before we saw it.
  i don't think this craft is of alien origin because of the flight path and the fact that it travelled in such a straight line but i would like to find any correlation to other reports and govt activities to determine what is going on.
  i want to hear your theories via email but do not welcome calls.
content.summary: Orange glowing object with aura.  second time in less than a month.  both times moving from south east to north west at approx 120 degrees.

content.detailedDescription: I went outside to lock my car and saw some fireworks outside. as i looked up i saw 3 prominent and distinct orange orb like lights. i just stood there in the parking lot looking at them. i noticed that there were 3 independent objects and that they were moving. 2 of them were already past my position but the last of the three flew/drifted right over my head.I actually thought they could be flares or something related to the 4th of july until i realized that they were flying away from me and not floating down toward the ground. i did not hear any sound like a helicopter or airplane. we live pretty close to cvg airport and i see planes all the time. i figured it was to low to be a plane and i didn't hear a helicopter.  i tried to take a picture with my cell phone but i have a poor quality phone and i couldn't make anything out in my viewfinder. i noticed they were kind of shimmering but the color did not change. kind of pulsated possibly but always stayed bright orange. was certainly not any fireworks. i put my phone away and they actually started moving faster way from me  and well. kind of zoomed off. they were just continuously moving faster until they were out of sight. i hopped into my car to try to set up my position with i-75/i-71 as my apartment complex is right next to north/south  i-75/i-71. to my best calculations it was traveling south eat coming from north west the entire time and basically all three whatever they were stayed in a pretty tight line although the were separated and kind of in a row. i was never afraid but rather excited. after i made my thoughts i realized that it had to be a ufo. not flares (they burn out and drift to the ground), not a plane (made no noise at all), not a helicopter (no noise). i don't think it could have been anything like a meteorite or comet (3 in a row and not streaking in the sky and were moving slow then speed up). maybe it was a flying rc controlled craft but i mean they were so far stretched apart and eventually traveled really quickly. i don't know. i am just trying to give my understanding and rationalize but i guess that's your guy's job. it would be great to speak to someone further on this. i jotted down some basic info so i could remember the event.
content.summary: Saw 3 glowing orbs each behind one another fly overhead then speed up till they sped off

content.detailedDescription: I was in my kitchen at the sink doing something.  i casually looked towards the west as my kitchen faces west.  in the sky i saw the strangest cloud i have ever seen.  looked like an arrow head.  if it was just a cloud, then mother nature is playing  a trick.  this jet chemical trail comes from the southand heads north.  nothing strange, except the trail takes an a erupt halt, and goes towards the west.  i've taken 9 still pictures with my iphone 4.  i have attached here as well for your expert eye.  you can see the trail fading out toward the west.  then its gone.  no expansion of chemical trail as the south to north trail shows.  i thought this was worthy of a review.
content.summary: Saw strange clouds like a jets chem trail, but it abruptly stoped and went the other way.

content.detailedDescription: It was something like a star in the sky, but it was zigzagging. i don't think is an optical effect since the others stars (and planes) where no moving like that.
content.summary: Ufo like a star zigzagging in the space.

content.detailedDescription: I steped outside around 1055 pm to watch fireworks. i seen an orange light in the same path as approach to ohare and midway airports. thought first was a dull helo light. then it looked like orange ball with moving yellowish light below.  then i thought maybe some launched a big rocket. but i watched it rise from 10 o clock in the east to 12 o clock getting smaller and no explosions. i realized it was not a plane or helo. it seemed to be rising and disappeared from eye sight at about 2 o clock.Getting to small to see.  10 o clock in the east heading straight to 2 o clock in the west. it almost looked like a rocket launch but without a trail.  it was a orange ball with a yellowish orange trail that was about the same size as the object that rotated around the orange object.
content.summary: Unknown

content.detailedDescription:
Walking home this evening from the piqua ohio firework show i looked up to see the orange-red object moving from east to west. at first i thought it may be a helicopter or a light aircraft. i watched it for a few seconds and i never saw the standard white, green, and red lights. i then pointed it out to the person i was with and they also thought it looked strange. i continued to watch it still thinking i must be just seeing it from a bad angle blocking my view of the other lights. after about 20 seconds the object turned ssw, that is when i was sure it was something odd since i still did not see any other lights except the glowing orange-red light. after the object turned ssw it appeared to gain altitude then the light dimmed out. i did not see the object appear i just happened to look up and notice it, it may or may not have been visible for long before i noticed it. after i noticed it was visible for just under a minute. 
as a fan of aircraft and astrology i always keep an i to the sky. i live on the flight path of the area care-flight helicopter and also on the ns approach for dayton airport. hartzell airport is also just 2 miles from my home and wright-patterson air-force base is about 30 miles south of my location. i am used to seeing various aircraft from medical, civilian, military, and private aircraft but this one left me confused.
only thing i can think it could be would be military jet with afterburner but i did not hear any sound at all.
content.summary: Orange-red non-flashing light moving from east to west then turned south-south-west before fading away.

content.detailedDescription: My mother and i were sitting on the back deck watching fireworks show tonight 7/4/14. over the east sky of denver there were 4 disc shaped objects hovering over the largest fireworks as if watching. they hovered a few moments then seemed to merge into one object and disappeared as fast as they arrived. they stayed in place about five minutes .
content.summary: Watching fireworks show with 4 obvious disc shape objects looking down at the fireworks show  changed color from white beam to red, merged into one and left.
content.locationName: Over fireworks show in De, Colorado

content.detailedDescription:
This is what i wrote my daughter immediately following the sighting. i wrote while the experience was fresh.---------------

guess what!? i think i saw 3 ufos tonight. well, at least ufos in that they were unidentified. i was posting on fb about watching the fireworks from my balcony when i noticed some lights behaving very differently from the fireworks. for one thing they originated from a part of the sky where there were no fireworks. if you look straight out my balcony you'll be facing almost due north exactly. ( it's  actually about 2 degrees off according to my compass.) the fireworks were in the north to northeast east area of the sky. (it looked like they were being set off from the high school.) these odd lights originated about 5 degrees west of due north. ( from the area near the expressway.)  it was hard to see in the dark exactly what they were. i can say they were higher in the sky than the fireworks, just below the cloud line. i saw one, single light that i am positive was not a firework. it originated in the sky with no tail at all. no tracer from a lit fuse.  it traveled in a horizontal path several hundred feet above the tree line. the path was from the north in a swinging arc over the condo roofs to the west. it was followed by another about a minute later then one more maybe a minute later. three in all. (that i saw. there may have been more earlier when i was inside.) i got the binoculars out to see them better. could only see a light, no shadow of an airplane or helicopter, either of which have at least 2 if not 4 lights on them for night flight. the light was very bright and a red/orange segmented in color. they looked like large, flying light bulbs. hard to tell the exact size because i couldn't judge the distance in the dark. but at least the size of grapefruit. 

my first thought was," ok, we know this isn't a real ufo, what is it though?" because of the odd color of the light i thought it might be a kids science project, a homemade weather type balloon made from a small candle and a paper bag but like i said, it did not flicker and the path was steady not "drifty". it flew pretty high and never wavered. each subsequent light flew the same way, the same direction. airplanes and the like have multiple lights on them and i think i would have seen the shadow in the sky of the body of the airplane especially with the binoculars. maybe they were drones? i know you can buy them privately (theo's neighbor has one that buzzes the upstairs windows periodically.) but i would think they would be pretty pricey. and i saw 3 of them. that's a great deal of private money in the sky at one time. and i don't think i would put them in the air with all the yokels setting off rockets and sky cannons. i couldn't hear them make any noise but then the fireworks were going off at the same time. but even in between booms i couldn't make out a buzz or hum or rumble of any kind. 

so, if you have any ideas what i saw i am open to suggestions. it'll bug me all
content.summary: 3 glowing red/orange lights in sky traveling on a straight, unwavering path horizontal to tree tops.

content.detailedDescription: Friday, july 4th 2014, around 10:10-10:15 or so.  the neighborhood was watching the fireworks, when i heard several people asking what something in the sky was.  my daughter came to me and asked me what it was, she pointed toward the moon, the object was just left of the moon, this was far more west than any of the fireworks which were directly south.  observed large greenish-blueish light hovering, witnessed by around 20 people including several neighbors from street.  everyone was pointing and asking what it was.  i said i thought it was a plane, because it had a flashing light, but the realized planes usually have a more rapid flash with two double blinks or so.  this was more like a slower pulse.  it then started moving south slowly, increasing speed.  i then said this must be a helicopter or some type of drone.  the light instantly changed direction, moving in the opposite direction, at a very, very high rate of speed.  much faster than any plane could go.  we were all in awe, and i said that is no drone or helicopter, nothing can move that fast and change direction like that.  everybody seemed shocked.  we see planes flying over our area all day, and nothing goes this fast.  as it was traveling north, only the color red could be observed and it was not flashing any more, it was only a solid red.  there was no more bluish-green color.  it quickly disappeared as it got too far away to see.  my neighbor captured a couple seconds of video on her phone.  i watched the video while in the dark driveway, and could only see a small dot on the video.  she tried to capture it as it was flying away to the north, so it did not turn out very well.  everyone was amazed at what we saw with many saying they never believed in ufo's but now have changed their minds.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Large light, greenish blue, flashing red, hovered, then moved south, sudden change north at high rate of speed

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were outside watching the fireworks. about 9:45 my mom, sister, aunt, and cousin saw something quickly fly over. we began to investigate to see if it might be a satellite on one of our stargazing apps on the iphone. there were none that were in that area. then about 30 minutes later i was standing outside facing south and saw very clearly a green vessel or something similar flying over. i called my aunt over because she was outside. she saw it too. we watched it fly right over head and i followed it as it went as north as i could see. it was a kelly green color with lights that looked like thy were on wings that were flapping or they were rotating in a circle. it made no noise. my aunt and i said "that is wild, that is not a satellite". but we did not know what it was.
content.summary: Green lights that either went in a circle or looked like it was flapping. it went straight over head and crossed over from horizon to horizon in 2 minutes or less.

content.detailedDescription: My fiance' and i were setting off fireworks, just like all our neighbors. one of our neighbors set off some big fireworks. both me and my fiance' saw what we thought at first to be burning embers of a firework. but as we watched it, it did not burn out and sort of "cruised" in the sky. my fiance' went to grab the camera, but by the time he got back it had burned out. we were in mt. pleasant, south carolina at the time and it was around 9:30 p.M. i have always been fascinated with space, and this really kind of scared me. i yelled for my fiance', and panicked. i did not lose sight of the object, it just vanished.
content.summary: Fireball-type right after fireworks, but not an ember. moved too fast, and on a flight plan.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were sitting outback of the house watching local fireworks at about 10:15. my wife first observed the object and drew my attention to it. i first thought it was an aircraft in distress, but after observing and considering it, i dismissed that for several reasons: 1) there was no sound although it appeared to be less than 1/2 mile distant; 2) it flew at a constant altitude of apx. 1000 ft. and sw linear direction; 3) it had a roughly ball shape that appeared as if it was glowing and in flames which gave it also a teardrop appearance; 4) the flames did not trail due to speed; 5) there were no lights commonly associated with aircraft.

the object was in our view for maybe a minute or so until its trajectory took it out of view behind tree tops. i've seen a lot of stuff: i saw sputnik when i was a kid; i've seen comets; i've seen meteors; i've seen numerous satellites; i've seen spacecraft; i've seen lots of aircraft at night; i've seen hot air balloons (not at night), but i've never seen anything like this.
content.summary: Orange-red ball of fire travelling apx. 150-200 mph with flaming appearance. flames straight up. no sound. constant speed and altitude.

content.detailedDescription: Came in from the north flew over my house turned slightly then straight up out of sight in a couple of seconds
content.summary: Flew over my house then straight up out of sight in a couple seconds

content.detailedDescription:
Tonight my son a friend and i went out to set off some fireworks. as soon as we went out, we all saw the same thing. three glowing red orbs crossing the sky. they were in close proximity to each other and then slowly dimmed out till you couldn't see them. 

about a minute or less after the first three were no longer visible, a fourth object - same thing - appeared and traveled in an identical path as the first three and then dimmed out at about the same spot as the first three. 

my son got video of both events on his iphone. sorry for all the commentary in the videos, but these were not planes...
content.summary: Three red object observed, followed by single red object all had same characteristics.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from my girlfriends house one night on pearl street in tacoma wa. as i headed down the road i saw to my right a hovering disc right above a small power station on the corner of pearl and 26th street. i pulled over into a gas station just across the street and got out of my car. i stood looking up at it right across from me for several minutes as it just hovered there in one place. after a few minutes the craft silently moved over to pearl street. i jumped in my car and followed it  fly on the path of the road for almost one mile it turned left and i followed it as it flew slowly down 11th street for a short time when it just accelerated at a very fast speed out of sight. i did call the police and the operator told me that they had several calls that night but nobody would file a report. she asked if i would and stupidly i agreed. when the officers arrived they pretty much laughed at me. i know exactly what i saw it was a flying disc so close i could have hit it with a rock. i was 23 years old at the time and now 59. this is something i think about often. probably too often. i have never seen anything like this again. i tend to come on ufo sites from time to time hoping to find a similar sighting in tacoma around that time when i witnessed mine. i haven't found that but maybe my experience will reassure someone else out there who shared my experience. even though i live in san diego now i still make it a point to visit that corner every time we visit relatives in tacoma.
content.summary: Witnessed ufo hovering over power station

content.detailedDescription: Can out of north flew over my house then went straight up out of sight in a couple seconds
content.summary: Can out of north over my hose then straight up out of sight

content.detailedDescription: I was looking at the moon. then a bright orange ball of light appeared. i noticed it was pulsing with red light also. it looked liked it was coming toward me. i said to myself, what the f is that? as i watched it, i saw it had made a turn to the east. it was traveling at a high rate of speed. then the light became fainter and finally went out.
content.summary: Bright orange ball of light, with red pusle. moved to ne then moved e and then puff was gone.

content.detailedDescription: Coming back from watching fireworks at my dads, i looked out the window of the car and saw what looked like a bell like object in the sky. clearly stationary, it was too big to be a star, and was in no way a plane or aircraft. i was absolutely shocked and was unable to describe what i was seeing to my partner even though i was trying desperately to get him to look. it wasn't doing anything that i could tell, just sitting there in the night sky like it was also enjoying the fireworks that had recently stopped. from what i could see this bell shaped object was bright at the top like an orange lightbulb and nearest the bottom it looked like the light had faded and was about the size of a pill. it is a clear night sky tonight with stars visible in every direction, so that bright orange red was what really caught my attention. i've never seen anything like that before! we were taking a winding path to my house and didn't have anywhere we could stop to observe it further. unfortunately my partner never had the chance to see it. when we got home we hopped on our bikes and rode out to the area i last saw it. but it had already vanished. i'd love to see some pictures if anyone managed to get footage of it.
content.summary: Strange red orange bell shaped object stationary in the sky

content.detailedDescription: Around 9:00 pm i went outside to watch the 4th of july fireworks. as i was looking upward, toward the southeast, i saw a red glowing light. at first i thought it was an airplane, since we are very close to the airport, only it did not appear to have the configuration or the strobe effect of any commercial aircraft that i am familiar with. the first one traveled in an inclined path to the northwest, and disappeared into a cloudless sky. a second object appeared about two minutes later, same characteristics, same angle of incline, and disappeared off into the northwest. i have pictures, although i don't think they are very good ones. i wanted to try taking pictures of fireworks, and got a glowing red orb instead....
content.summary: 2 objects, about 2 minutes apart, same direction, same angle, disappeared in a cloudless sky

content.detailedDescription: This happens every 4th of july for the last 4 years. the fireworks seem to attract them. i get outside my from yard every 4th just to see them.I have video but cannot send due to my cell service.You need to get to hudson florida next 4th of july and see for your self. i began to take a video of them and they seemed to stop overhead to see what i was doing.They started as 3 coming from the north and dissappear. then from the south they came again. always bright glow of red.Pulsating. no sound. they came overhead about 10 to 15 times. then from the east almost a few hundred feet off the rooftops. sometimes they come slow and sometimes they are very fast.Very unique
content.summary: Glowing red orbs

content.detailedDescription: My wife was letting a neighbors dog out because they were on vacation. she came in our house at 22:00 and told me she had seen 2 different pairs of globes flying around the sky. i immediately went in my front yard and observed 2 orange globes traveling north to south across the sky. they made no noise and appeared to me to be at a very high altitude.  i have lived in my home over 12 years and i'm always looking up at the night sky and i have never seen anything airplane or otherwise that looked like this. i did not see the other pair of globes my wife had mentioned seeing at all. i took a video with my iphone 5 and it is attached. i realize also it is the 4th of july and there are many fireworks going on in the area but these were absolutely no firework.
content.summary: Orange globes moving fast across night sky. no sounds heard.

content.detailedDescription:
This was a gliding orange red fireball. very bright heading over us west to east toward detroit about 15 miles west of.

it looked beautiful in its vibrant, bright color steady in it drift.. we know here are fireworks tonight. this was not a firework with its height, vibrancy and our intuition 


 i will review the pic from my (shaky)  camera .  saw by two mufon adult women.
content.summary: Brilliant orange red fireball

content.detailedDescription:
I looked up at clear sky for no reason and saw a translucent cylinder shaped cage like craft hovering at approximately 60angle maybe 1000 ft.Up, it was pulsating and silent. it was the same color as a vapor trail off a jet ( was way to distinctive for a vapor trail) i watched for about a minute went inside and got my wife who also witnessed it, we looked at each other to talk looked back up and it was gone . that was the first time i had ever seen a ufo 
thank you [name removed /cms/tg]
content.summary: Craft was translucent cage like, pulsating

content.detailedDescription: Playing cards outside noticed a bright light after observing for an hour completely disappeared . completely dumbfounded
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Watched a constant bright light start south traveled to north then west with periods of hoovering

content.detailedDescription: My wife an i were camping in the motor home june 28 thru july 2nd on 6/29 sunday we were sitting watching two eagles fight with 3 seagulls over some food an had been fighting off an on all day right by our camp site .We decided to try and get a close up picture of the eagles .So we walked about 150 feet over to get close because i only had a i phone 5 for a camera .I took 4 pictures of one eagle in the tree 2 pictures regular camera an 2 using the zoom function on the phone.I didn't see the object till later that night looking at the pictures .I showed my wife  the eagle and the jet contrail and said what do you think that is .I was pointing at the whit object in the picture she didn't know.When we got home on tue7/1 at 7:30pm i was showing the picture to my dentist friend while i was scrolling through  my pictures i realized i had taken more then one shot of the object an it had moved . i'm unsure what's in that pictures but its got the tree the jet contrail an then the object between the two .As of today i went an had 8x10s made iam keeping the originals in the phone for now .
content.summary: I took pictures of an eagle in a tree in portage alaska an that night iooked at the pictures  an saw the object i was taking pics one after another on my i phone 5
